page.title: 01INTRODUCTION
page.content:
The block is in many ways typical of rural Buchan in N.E. Scotland, but has its own unique features.
It slopes gently from a height of 107 metres in the west to a height of 132 metres at the centre 46 metres in the east. The land drains south and east into the River Ugie system. Land use is predominantly forestry in the west and arable/stockrearing in the east. There is one village, Fetterangus, a planned settlement of the 1770's near a much older and now deserted site. The small settlement at Cairnorchies seems to be based on an old system of smallholdings. Other habitations in the block are based on farms or crofts.
There is evidence of human occupation from prehistoric times.
